byline.contributor: Sewell Chan and Oleg Matsnev contributed reporting.

abstract: Killing of Russian Ambassador Andrey G Karlov by Turkish Police Officer Mevlut Mert Altintas may indicate lingering disloyalties within Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's government, regardless of whether Altintas was follower of Muslim cleric Fethullah Gulen, Al Qaeda affiliate Nusra Front or Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The affiliation of the man who killed Russia’s ambassador remains unclear, but the assassination betrayed a glaring unknown among forces that have pledged fealty to the president.
snippet: The affiliation of the man who killed Russia’s ambassador remains unclear, but the assassination betrayed a glaring unknown among forces that have pledged fealty to the president....

headline.main: Turkey Assassination Suggests Erdogan’s Loyalty Problem Is Lingering
headline.print_headline: Killing Shows Erdogan Still on Shaky Ground
